author: Will MacDonald
title: Here and Now: Food Truck Friday rolling into Mount Holly
text: Posted Oct. 8, 2015 at 3:17 PM Updated at 3:22 PM Posted Oct. 8, 2015 at 3:17 PM Updated at 3:22 PM Another Food Truck Friday rolls into downtown Mount Holly from 5 to 8 p.m. Oct. 23. Some of the trucks and food vendors that will be there are Beheler’s Shave Ice, Gyro Twins, Hot Box Next Level Street Food, New Wrap order, OooWee BBQ, Taco Green-Go and Wendy’s Weiner’s. The evening features music, children’s activities and a pumpkin patch. Bring a blanket or lawn chair. September's event brought out hundreds of Food Truck enthusiasts. YOU CAN STILL SCORE A TICKET FOR BEER WALK There’s still tickets left for Saturday’s Beer Walk: A Taste of the South taking place from 1 to 3 p.m. Saturday, Oct. 11, at the Daniel Stowe Botanical Garden, 6500 S. New Hope Road, Belmont. Guests can check out selections from breweries in the Carolinas, Georgia, Virginia, Tennessee and Louisiana. Breweries include Abita Brewing Company, RJ Rockers Brewery, Quest Brewing Company, Terrapin Beer Co., Mother Earth Brewery, Blue Mountain Brewery, Fortnight Brewing Company, The Unknown Brewing Company and more. The day will feature music by Chris Hertz and cornhole. Tickets are available for $20 in advance online until Oct. 9 and will be available at the door for $25. Garden members receive 15 percent off. Each participant will also receive a commemorative sampling glass while supplies last. To register, visit www.DSBG.org/event/beerwalk . For more information about this and other events, visit www.DSBG.org or call 704-829-1252. LIONS CLUB COOKING UP PINTO BEAN DINNER The East Gastonia Lions Club holds a Poor Man’s Supper from 5 to 8 p.m. Oct. 23 at Maylo United Methodist Church, 1900 Spencer Mountain Road, Gastonia. The menu includes pinto beans, coleslaw, stewed apples, cornbread and a drink. Cost per person is $6 for adults and $4 for children under age 12. LEBO'S CUSTOMERS HELP THE MDA The Lebo’s in Gastonia and the other eight stores in North and South Carolina recently wrapped up the company’s first Pin-Up campaign for the Muscular Dystrophy Association. The stores sold camp-themed $1 and $5 pin-up mobiles to customers between July 13 and Aug. 31. A total $3,549 was raised to help children fighting muscular dystrophy, ALS and other life-threatening diseases that affect muscle strength and mobility. The camp-themed pin-ups promote the MDA’s summer camp for children ages 6 to 17 where they participate in a week of activities. It costs $800 to send a child to the summer camp. Lebo’s sells footwear, western wear and dance wear. The Gastonia store is at 1405 E. Franklin Blvd. REUNIONS ANNOUNCED Page 2 of 2 - * Descendents of A.L. Heavner and Ellen Hallmon Heavner hold a family reunion at 1 p.m. Oct. 18 at Webbs Chapel Baptist Church, Crouse. Those attending should bring a well-filled picnic basket. For more information, call Vivian Patterson, 704-435-2295, or Faye Heavner, 704-735-2470. * The 1955 Dallas High School Class Reunion takes place at 2 p.m. Nov. 7 at First Presbyterian Church Fellowship Hall, 412 W.
